title: Vice President, Information Services
content:
We are seeking a talented forward-thinking and strategic Vice President, Information Services who will be responsible for leading Buckner's information services function, and ensuring strategy is aligned with ministry and business strategy, and technologies are available to meet business demands. This role is the key driver, champion and visionary of effective and innovative technologies strategic initiatives that advance the organization’s IS infrastructure to support business operations compliance with regulatory requirements, security of systems and data, and management of IS solutions and tools necessary to achieve business objectives.
Primary Responsibilities:

Strategic business partner in support of the mission, vision and values of the organization and work as a member of the leadership team in aligning IS strategies to organizational objectives.
Deliver a comprehensive information services strategy and infrastructure and support operational leaders to achieve each business unit’s strategic technologies objectives.
Develop and execute a comprehensive data analysis-driven technologies strategic planning process for the identification of infrastructure, data security, and technology needs.
responsible for development, management, and execution of an information security program, including policies and procedures required for compliance with HIPAA, HITECH, and other applicable regulations.
Oversee the development, implementation and administration of IT policies, programs and services that align with and support organizational objectives.
Oversee selection and management of all technologies systems including, but not limited to, contracts, vendor relationships and negotiations.
Monitor trends and changes in information services practices and legislation on local, state, and federal level; oversee and ensure compliance with all technology laws and regulations.

Ideal candidates will possess the following educational requirements, abilities, and competencies:

Bachelor’s Degree in a related field of study required.
Requires a minimum of 15 years of progressively responsible information services and technology experience.
Possess functional expertise across all general areas of information technology systems, tools and security.
Ability to work collaboratively, and gain executive and managerial buy-in, to gain support for information services initiatives.
Prior related experience in managing the information services function in a multi-site organization, or multi-industry operations, and a large non-exempt population with a minimum of 1,000 employees preferred.
The same way we treat our employees is how we treat all applicants – with respect. Buckner is an equal opportunity employer (EEO is the law). You will be treated fairly throughout our recruiting process and without regard to race, color, religion, ​age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status in consideration for a career at Buckner.
